--- title: Example Table author: Your Name date: today format: html: df-print: paged pdf: pdf-engine: pdflatex include-in-header: title.tex toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib link-citations: true abstract: | This template demonstrates a complete Quarto report with titles, sections, tables, references, formulas, cross-references, and executable code. --- # Intro This document is a reusable template for analytical reports in Quarto. It supports citations like Roback and Legler @roback2021beyond and Schober et al. @schober2018. You can also use custom macros from the header like \myterm{term} and \mybox{Hello from a macro!}. We will reference Equation @eq-logreg, Figure @fig-sine, and Table @tbl-sample as examples. # Methods ## Model We use logistic regression to model binary outcomes: $$ P(y=1\mid x)=\sigma(w^\top x + b)=\frac{1}{1+e^{-(w^\top x + b)}} $$ {#eq-logreg} For correlated features, interpret coefficients carefully; see @schober2018 for guidance on correlation. ## Data Example data dictionary: | Variable | Type | Description | |:-----------------|:---------|:------------------------------------| | age | numeric | Age in years | | educational-num | numeric | Years of education | | hours-per-week | numeric | Weekly work hours | | workclass | category | Employment type | | income_>50K | binary | 1 if income > 50K, else 0 | # Results ## Example Figure ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt x = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 300) plt.plot(x, np.sin(x), color="#2E86AB", lw=2) plt.xlabel("x") plt.ylabel("sin(x)") plt.title("Sine Wave") plt.grid(alpha=0.3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Sample figure demonstrating a simple sine wave.](statreport_files/figure-pdf/fig-sine-output-1.pdf){#fig-sine fig-pos='H'} ::: ::: ::: {#tbl-sample .cell tbl-cap='Sample data table created in Python.' execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd df = pd.DataFrame({ "Metric": ["Accuracy", "Precision", "Recall", "F1"], "Score": [0.85, 0.79, 0.72, 0.75] }) df ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}
Metric Score
0 Accuracy 0.85
1 Precision 0.79
2 Recall 0.72
3 F1 0.75
``` ::: ::: We refer to Figure @fig-sine and Table @tbl-sample for demonstration. # Discussion - Quarto enables reproducible, documented analysis with code and narrative. - Equations like @eq-logreg are first-class citizens alongside figures and tables. - Use citations such as @roback2021beyond to anchor methods in literature. # Conclusion This template can be cloned for new reports. Replace text, update references, and embed your analysis code. # Appendix ## Additional Math A simple linear model: $$ y = X\beta + \varepsilon $$ {#eq-ols} Refer to Equation @eq-ols in text. ## Re-usable Blocks - Use sections and sub-sections to structure content. - Add callouts, code-folding, and filters as needed. - Keep references in references.bib and cite with `@key`. # References
